meanings.definition: Designed to resist tampering or alteration.
meanings.sent1: The tamperproof lock on the safe kept our belongings safe.
meanings.sent2: It is important to use tamperproof seals on important documents.
meanings.sent3: The tamperproof packaging was so secure, even the cat couldn't open it.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like a tamperproof vault, guarding her deepest secrets.
meanings.sent5: The tamperproof fence around the garden ensured no one could sneak in.

meanings.definition: A device or system that is difficult to tamper with or alter.
meanings.sent1: The company invested in tamperproof technology to protect their data.
meanings.sent2: The tamperproof on the alarm system prevented any unauthorized changes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to open the tamperproof box but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact was stored in a tamperproof case to preserve its integrity.
meanings.sent5: The tamperproof software ensured the security of sensitive information.
